message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll be satisfied with the quality. I'm willing to provide a 10% discount if you buy now, but only for this round. The price would be $90.
I'm not sure about the quality of the product, and I'm not willing to pay $90 or $100 without knowing the quality. I'd like to see the product first and make a decision based on its actual quality.

I understand your concerns, Bob. However, I'd like to propose a compromise. I'll give you a detailed description of the product, and you can make a decision based on that. If you decide to buy, I'll give you a 20% discount for this round, making the price $80. If you still want to see the product first, I'll send you a picture of it, and you can decide then.
I'm still not convinced. A description and a picture won't guarantee the quality of the product. I'd like to see the product in person and have it revealed to me before making a decision.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'm willing to take a risk to build trust. I'll offer you a 'test purchase' option. If you buy the product, and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. You can take the product home, inspect it, and if you're not satisfied, return it for a full refund. This way, you can see the product in person and make a decision with confidence. The price remains $100.
